inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: history of asthma for 3 years, suffering from frequent cough, wheezing, and shortness of breath and chest tightness

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Demonstrated >=12% and >=200 mL reversibility of FEV1 within 10 to 40 minutes after 2 to 4 inhalations of salbutamol inhalation aerosol

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Currently uses inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg, one puff twice daily

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: No history of intubation and/or hypercapnia, respiratory arrest or hypoxic seizures within the last 10 years

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: No asthma exacerbation requiring oral corticosteroids within 12 weeks of Visit 1

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: No current evidence of pneumonia, pneumothorax, atelectasis, pulmonary fibrotic disease, bronchopulmonary dysplasia, chronic bronchitis, emphysema, COPD or other respiratory abnormalities

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: No clinically significant, uncontrolled condition or disease state that would put the safety of the subject at risk through study participation or confound the interpretation of the efficacy results
